[[File:BatteriesIncluded.jpg|right]] '''Batteries Included''' ('''BI''') was a [[computer software]] and [[computer hardware|hardware]] company based in the [[Toronto]] area. It was well known in the 1980s for its popular [[PaperClip]] [[word processor]], which was available for [[Atari]] and [[Commodore International|Commodore]] microcomputers.
[[Michael Reichmann]] joined the company in its early years and eventually became its president. In this capacity he was frequently interviewed in consumer and industry publications such as [[InfoWorld]]. [http://www.google.co.uk/search?hl=en&tbo=1&tbm=bks&q=%22batteries+included%22+%22Michael+Reichmann%22+infoworld&btnG=Search]
Batteries Included was purchased by [[Electronic Arts]] in 1987, which cancelled most of its upcoming projects<ref name="iansquest">{{cite journal | title = Ian's Quest | author = Ian Chadwick | journal = ST-Log | issue = 20 | year = 1988 | page = 47 }}</ref> but continued to market products under the Batteries Included name.
